info.name: API documentation
info.description:
# Description

This api allows you to see weather features such as maximum, feels like temperatures, humidity for the given city up to 48 hours.

---

The Weather Forecast provides you to see weather features for the given city.

`List of HTTP methods available in this API`

- HTTP GET api/forecast/{cityName}
    

## **Getting started guide**

To start using the Weather Forecast API, you need to -

- You must use a valid API Key to send requests to the API endpoints. You can get your API key from open weather website. Please put your API key to the Constants.java file of in project folder.
    

## Expected Response

"lat": latitude of the given city,  
"lon": longitude of the given city,  
"timezone": "Europe/Istanbul" example,  
"timezone_offset": time zone offset of the given city,

"hourly": \[ // Hourly data of the given city, this should contain 48 different objects. Each object refers an hour.  
{  
"dt": 1700517600,  
"temp": 287.5,  
"feels_like": 286.74,  
"pressure": 1015,  
"humidity": 67,  
"dew_point": 281.46,  
"uvi": 0.0,  
"clouds": 75,  
"visibility": 10000,  
"wind_speed": 3.68,  
"wind_deg": 244,  
"wind_gust": 4.53,  
"weather": \[  
{  
"id": 500,  
"main": "Rain",  
"description": "light rain",  
"icon": "10n"  
}  
\],  
"pop": 0.55  
},

item.name: Collections

request.description: Gets information about a collection. For a complete list of this endpoint's possible values, use the [collection.json schema file](https://schema.postman.com/json/collection/v2.1.0/collection.json).
